benchmark_details.name: MAQA (Multi-Answer Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: MAQA is a new dataset that introduces data uncertainty by constructing questions requiring multiple answers across world knowledge, mathematical reasoning, and commonsense reasoning tasks, aimed at evaluating uncertainty quantification methods.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate uncertainty quantification methods in the context of data uncertainty by using a new dataset.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Although we conducted quality checks, there may remain some ambiguous questions or unclear answers; also, the data primarily consists of short-form answers making the analysis of long-form answers challenging.

data.source: Constructed dataset using both modified existing datasets and newly created questions with the help of LLMs (GPT-4-turbo).
data.annotation: Quality checked by human review and validated with multiple iterations of questions to ensure clarity and factual accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of single answers, using precision, recall, and F1 score for multiple answers.
methodology.interpretation: High AUROC and AUPRC scores indicate effective uncertainty quantification methods that can distinguish correct from incorrect predictions.
methodology.validation: Validated through consensus among multiple authors for quality checks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The MAQA dataset is distributed under the Apache 2.0 license.
